title: copycat
text: don’t know many times searched old scripts, especially ggplot code snippet, forgotten details little piece worl. reason, started create package. CopyCat comes small data set (CopyCatCode) contains minimal examples several cheat sheet examples run without ado. example, let’s look code examples ggplot2 package. CopyCatCode data provides package name, function, code minimal example: Let’s say remember pivot_longer tidyr package works. Just search corresponding code snippet via copycat() function, searches code snippet copies returned code clipboard. see code returned, use corresponding copycat_code() function. Since code based implemented data – examples listed CopyCat – can see function works pasting console. Alternatively, set run option TRUE copycat() sends code console. course, minimal examples run package loaded time know package name. However, sometimes look package name use function often. copycat_package() function returns corresponding package name sends code library(...) directly console. copycat_package() function copies code also clipboard, since want insert script well. add typos accident, sure whether function written small large caps, might lucky similar match found data. Unfortunately, works match found .
code:
## load library and provide a data frame  library(copycat)  CopyCatCode %>%    filter(package == "ggplot2") %>%    arrange(fct) #> # A tibble: 43 × 3 #>    package fct          code                                                     #>    <chr>   <chr>        <chr>                                                    #>  1 ggplot2 annotate     "ggplot(mtcars, aes(x=mpg)) +   
  geom_histogram(co… #>  2 ggplot2 facet_grid   "ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg)) + 
  geom_blank() + … #>  3 ggplot2 facet_wrap   "ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg)) + 
  geom_blank() + … #>  4 ggplot2 geom_abline  "ggplot(mpg, aes(cty, hwy))+
  geom_point()+
  ge… #>  5 ggplot2 geom_area    "ggplot(mpg, aes(hwy))+
  geom_area(stat = "bin")"  #>  6 ggplot2 geom_bar     "ggplot(data=mpg, aes(x=class)) + geom_bar()"            #>  7 ggplot2 geom_bin_2d  "ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price))+ geom_bin2d(binwid… #>  8 ggplot2 geom_boxplot "ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=color, y=carat, fill=color)) +\… #>  9 ggplot2 geom_col     "ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=color, y=carat)) +
  geom_co… #> 10 ggplot2 geom_contour "ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, z = density)… #> # … with 33 more rows # copycat("pivot_longer") saves the returned code to the clipboad #>[1] "🐈 Your code: relig_income %>% tidyr::pivot_longer(!religion, names_to = #>'income', values_to = 'count')" # copycat_code() let us inspect what the function returned  copycat_code("pivot_longer") #> [1] "🐈 Your code: pivot_longer(table4a, cols = 2:3, names_to ="year",
             values_to = "cases")" copycat("pivot_longer", run = T ) relig_income %>%    pivot_longer(!religion, names_to = 'income', values_to = 'count') #> # A tibble: 180 × 3 #>    religion income             count #>    <chr>    <chr>              <dbl> #>  1 Agnostic <$10k                 27 #>  2 Agnostic $10-20k               34 #>  3 Agnostic $20-30k               60 #>  4 Agnostic $30-40k               81 #>  5 Agnostic $40-50k               76 #>  6 Agnostic $50-75k              137 #>  7 Agnostic $75-100k             122 #>  8 Agnostic $100-150k            109 #>  9 Agnostic >150k                 84 #> 10 Agnostic Don't know/refused    96 #> # … with 170 more rows #search for a package name, copies the load and loads the library copycat_package("pivot_longer") #>[1] [1] "🐈 Mission accomplished, loaded and copied library: tidyr" #typos and other mistakes  copycat_package("bivot") #> [1] "Did you mean pivot_longer from the tidyr package?" #> [2] "Did you mean pivot_wider from the tidyr package?" copycat("bivatasa") #>[1] "💩 Sooorry, I've got no idea what you are looking for!"

title: copycat
text: CopyCat can also connected Github repository copy one old scripts. First, setup Github account details, CopyCat needs search. Provide name author, repository, branch name. copycat_gitsearch() function uses Github API search within repository shows R scripts live within repository. copycat_git() function copies code script clipboard. opycat_gitplot("datasaurus") sends code console.
code: git_setup <- c(author = "edgar-treischl",                repository = "Graphs",                branch = "main") copycat_gitsearch() #> # A tibble: 2 × 1 #>   git_scripts   #>   <chr>         #> 1 R/ggplots.R   #> 2 R/plotgraph.R copycat_git("datasaurus") #>[1] "🐈 Mission accomplished!"

title: copycat
text: Often, need code runs see functions work. reason, CopyCat search within R help files vignettes, returns code listed vignette examples help file. copycat_helpsearch() function list help files package: copycat_help() function copies examples section help file clipboard. use example function base R inspect console. function exist search copy code vignettes. copycat_vigsearch() returns available vignettes package. copycat_vignette() copies script. copy smaller code chunks clipboard fine. Help files vignettes much longer. Therefore, may want create new file paste code new file. copycat_helpscript()create new R script copies examples help file script, copycat_vigscript() code vignette. CopyCat started personal package. Feel free use manage code snippets . Just add data frame variable names small example data (CopyCatCode) CopyCat handles snippets.
code: copycat_helpsearch("tidyr") #>  [1] "billboard"              "check_pivot_spec"       "chop"                   #>  [4] "cms_patient_experience" "complete"               "construction"           #>  [7] "deprecated-se"          "drop_na"                "expand"                 #> [10] "expand_grid"            "extract"                "extract_numeric"        #> [13] "fill"                   "fish_encounters"        "full_seq"               #> [16] "gather"                 "hoist"                  "household"              #> [19] "nest"                   "nest_legacy"            "pack"                   #> [22] "pipe"                   "pivot_longer"           "pivot_longer_spec"      #> [25] "pivot_wider"            "pivot_wider_spec"       "reexports"              #> [28] "relig_income"           "replace_na"             "separate"               #> [31] "separate_longer_delim"  "separate_rows"          "separate_wider_delim"   #> [34] "smiths"                 "spread"                 "table1"                 #> [37] "tidyr-package"          "tidyr_data_masking"     "tidyr_legacy"           #> [40] "tidyr_tidy_select"      "uncount"                "unite"                  #> [43] "unnest"                 "unnest_auto"            "unnest_longer"          #> [46] "unnest_wider"           "us_rent_income"         "who"                    #> [49] "world_bank_pop" #example saves examples of the online help files into your clipboard example("drop_na", package = "tidyr") #>  #> drop_n> df <- tibble(x = c(1, 2, NA), y = c("a", NA, "b")) #>  #> drop_n> df %>% drop_na() #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       x y     #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 a     #>  #> drop_n> df %>% drop_na(x) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>       x y     #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 a     #> 2     2 NA    #>  #> drop_n> vars <- "y" #>  #> drop_n> df %>% drop_na(x, any_of(vars)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       x y     #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 a copycat_vigsearch("tidyr") #> [1] "in-packages.R" "nest.R"        "pivot.R"       "programming.R" #> [5] "rectangle.R"   "tidy-data.R" copycat_vignette("tidyr", "pivot") #> "😎 copied that!" copycat_helpscript("tidyr", "pivot") copycat_vigscript("tidyr", "pivot")

what: Search, Copy, and Paste Code Snippets
title: Search, Copy, and Paste Code Snippets
text: CopyCat small package copy, paste, manage code snippets. CopyCat comes code snippets (minimal examples) run implemented data. CopyCat built personal package lazy cats, may help (new) R users manage code snippets.

title: Search, Copy, and Paste Code Snippets
Search, Copy, and Paste Code Snippets
text: Use addin get idea Copycat . CopyCat comes data (CopyCatCode) includes code snippets cheat sheets ggplot2 tidyr package (). data include package name, function name, code minimal example. Inspect data copy code copycat_addin() runs graphical interface examine data within viewer. Pick function press insert code button. RStudio inserts code .  , use addin. Let’s say remember pivot_longer tidyr package works. Just search corresponding code snippet via copycat() function. look code snippet saves returned code clipboard. inspect code actually returned, copycat_code() function might handy. Overall, CopyCat three different code sources. First, CopyCat comes data cheat sheets. course, can use code snippets well. Second, CopyCat can also fetch copy code lives Github. Ultimately, CopyCat searches also within R help files vignettes code illustrates function works. See vignette examples use CopyCat Github, help vignette files.
code: ## load library and provide a data frame  copycat::copycat_addin() library(copycat) # copycat("pivot_longer") saves the returned code to the clipboard #"🐱 copied that!" # copycat_code() let you inspect what the function returned  copycat_code("pivot_longer") #> [1] "🐈 Your code: pivot_longer(table4a, cols = 2:3, names_to =\"year\",\r\n             values_to = \"cases\")"
